intro: Oxymeris simplicicaulis, commonly known as the simple-stemmed oxymeris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in inflorescences at the leaf axils. Oxymeris simplicicaulis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Rubiaceae family, with potential ecological and medicinal significance.
